CCC Clock Demonstration System

API Reference

This section provides detailed documentation for all modules in the CCC Clock Demonstration System.

Core Modules

CCC Bridge Analysis Module

Enhanced bridge analysis specifically for CCC clock applications, building on the existing bridge_null tools with CCC-specific diagnostics and ε-continuation.

Key features: - Integration with existing bridge_null.py functionality - ε-continuation for residual E(R) = ||∏exp{-ε(N_e-RD_e)} - I|| - Enhanced commutator diagnostics with α factor calculations - CCC-specific bridge analysis for operational curvature validation

  • eps_factor – Reduction factor per step

Dictionary with detailed analysis results

CCC Clock Metrology Module

Implements the core equations for Computational Complexity Cosmology (CCC) clock theory including operational curvature, SNR calculations, and ABBA demodulation simulation.

Key equations: - Operational curvature: R_op = K_dot / (S_e_dot + S_loss_dot) - Clock observable: (Δf/f)_demod = Γ_Θ * R_op * A_Σ + systematics - SNR: SNR(τ) = (Γ_Θ * R_op * A_Σ) / (σ_0/√τ) - Time-to-detect: τ_req = (z_α * σ_0 / (Γ_Θ * R_op * A_Σ))²

class metrology.ParameterSet(name: str, K_dot: float, S_loss_dot: float, T: float, description: str)[source]

Bases: object

Parameter set for CCC clock experiments.

K_dot: float

class metrology.CCCMetrology(Gamma_Theta: float = 1e-06, kappa: float = 1.0)[source]

Bases: object

Main class for CCC clock metrology calculations.

__init__(Gamma_Theta: float = 1e-06, kappa: float = 1.0)[source]

Initialize CCC metrology calculator.

Parameters:

  • Gamma_Theta – Platform transfer factor for Θ-only loops

  • kappa – Operational geometry coupling constant

compute_operational_curvature(params: ParameterSet, S_e_dot: float | None = None) → float[source]

Compute operational curvature ratio R_op = K_dot / (S_e_dot + S_loss_dot).

Parameters:

  • params – Parameter set

  • S_e_dot – Semantic/mutual information rate (bits/s). If None, uses K_dot/10

Returns:

Operational curvature ratio (dimensionless)

compute_clock_observable(params: ParameterSet, A_Sigma: float, systematics: float = 0.0, S_e_dot: float | None = None) → float[source]

Compute clock observable (Δf/f)_demod = Γ_Θ * R_op * A_Σ + systematics.

Parameters:

  • params – Parameter set

  • A_Sigma – Loop area in (ln r*, θ) space

  • systematics – Systematic error contribution

  • S_e_dot – Semantic information rate

Returns:

Fractional frequency shift

compute_snr(params: ParameterSet, A_Sigma: float, sigma_0: float, tau: float, S_e_dot: float | None = None) → float[source]

Compute signal-to-noise ratio SNR(τ) = (Γ_Θ * R_op * A_Σ) / (σ_0/√τ).

Parameters:

  • params – Parameter set

  • A_Sigma – Loop area

  • sigma_0 – Allan deviation coefficient

  • tau – Integration time (s)

  • S_e_dot – Semantic information rate

Returns:

Signal-to-noise ratio

compute_time_to_detect(params: ParameterSet, A_Sigma: float, sigma_0: float, z_alpha: float = 3.0, S_e_dot: float | None = None) → float[source]

Compute time-to-detect τ_req = (z_α * σ_0 / (Γ_Θ * R_op * A_Σ))².

Parameters:

  • params – Parameter set

  • A_Sigma – Loop area

  • sigma_0 – Allan deviation coefficient

  • z_alpha – Detection threshold (standard deviations)

  • S_e_dot – Semantic information rate

Returns:

Required integration time (s)

sensitivity_analysis(A_Sigma_range: ndarray, sigma_0_values: List[float] = [1e-17, 3e-18], z_alpha: float = 3.0) → Dict[source]

Perform comprehensive sensitivity analysis across parameter space.

Parameters:

  • A_Sigma_range – Array of loop areas to test

  • sigma_0_values – List of Allan deviation coefficients

  • z_alpha – Detection threshold

Returns:

Dictionary with analysis results

simulate_lock_in_trace(params: ParameterSet, A_Sigma: float, duration: float = 3600, sigma_0: float = 3e-18, loop_reversed: bool = False, systematics_amplitude: float = 1e-19) → Dict[source]

Simulate lock-in amplifier trace with ABBA demodulation.

Parameters:

  • params – Parameter set

  • A_Sigma – Loop area

  • duration – Measurement duration (s)

  • sigma_0 – Allan deviation coefficient

  • loop_reversed – Whether loop is reversed (sign flip test)

  • systematics_amplitude – Amplitude of systematic errors

Returns:

Dictionary with simulation results

demonstrate_sign_flip(params: ParameterSet, A_Sigma: float, duration: float = 1800) → Dict[source]

Demonstrate sign flip under loop reversal (A3 acceptance criterion).

Parameters:

  • params – Parameter set

  • A_Sigma – Loop area

  • duration – Duration for each measurement

Returns:

Dictionary with both normal and reversed traces

CCC Protocol Design Module

Implements the protocol design for Θ-only non-commuting loops in CCC clock experiments, including ABBA sequencing, loop reversal, witness channels, and systematic error analysis.

Key components: - Θ-only loop specification in (ln r*, θ) operational space - ABBA sequencing with timing diagrams - Loop reversal mechanics and ensemble swap protocols - Witness channel modeling and orthogonality tests - Complexity/dissipation engineering specifications

A_SECOND = 'A2'

Dashboard Module

The dashboard provides real-time monitoring capabilities with the following key functions:

  • generate_mock_data(): Simulates realistic CCC measurement data

  • update_data_buffer(): Continuously updates measurement buffer

  • update_plots(): Refreshes all dashboard visualizations

  • update_interval(): Adjusts refresh rate based on user input

Animation Module

The animation system creates comprehensive visualizations:

  • create_theta_loop_3d(): Generates 3D Θ-loop geometry

  • create_abba_sequence(): Produces ABBA timing sequences

  • generate_ccc_signal(): Simulates CCC measurement signals

  • animate_frame(): Renders individual animation frames

Utility Functions

Additional utility functions for data processing and analysis:

  • load_measurement_data(): Loads experimental data files

  • calculate_allan_variance(): Computes frequency stability metrics

  • analyze_systematic_errors(): Evaluates error suppression performance

  • generate_validation_report(): Creates comprehensive test reports

Error Handling

The system includes robust error handling for:

  • Hardware communication failures

  • Data acquisition interruptions

  • Analysis computation errors

  • Dashboard connection issues

  • Animation rendering problems

All errors are logged with appropriate severity levels and user-friendly messages.

Configuration

System configuration is managed through:

  • config.yaml: Main configuration file

  • Environment variables for sensitive parameters

  • Command-line arguments for runtime options

  • Dashboard settings for visualization preferences

The configuration system supports both development and production deployments.
